 19#include <vsip/core/expr/unary_block.hpp>

 28
 29/// Unary function adapter for unary expression blocks.
 30/// The Operator template parameter of the expression block
 31/// template takes a single type argument, while user extension
 32/// functions take two. The Unary_function template provides
 33/// an adapter such that the Unary_function_return_type template
 34/// will do the right thing when given a 
 35/// 'Unary_function<Result, Function>::Type'.
 36template <typename R, typename F> 
 37struct Unary_function
 38{
 39  template <typename A>
 40  struct Type : std::unary_function<A, R>
 41  {
 42    static char const* name() { return "unary"; }
 43
 44    Type(F f) : function_(f) {}
 45
 46    R operator()(A a) const { return function_(a);}
 47
 48    F function_;
 49  };
 50};
 51
 52/// Partial specialization for Unary_function, taking a std::unary_function 
 53/// argument.
 54template <typename F>
 55struct Unary_function<typename F::result_type, F>
 56{
 57  template <typename Dummy>
 58  struct Type : std::unary_function<typename F::argument_type,
 59				    typename F::result_type>
 60  {
 61    static char const* name() { return "unary"; }
 62
 63    Type(F f) : function_(f) {}
 64
 65    typename F::result_type operator()(typename F::argument_type a) const 
 66    { return function_(a);}
 67
 68    F function_;
 69  };
 70};
 71
 72/// Partial specialization for Unary_function, taking a function pointer 
 73/// argument.
 74template <typename A, typename R>
 75struct Unary_function<R, R (*)(A)>
 76{
 77  template <typename Dummy>
 78  struct Type : std::pointer_to_unary_function<A, R>
 79  {
 80    static char const* name() { return "unary"; }
 81
 82    Type(R (*f)(A)) : std::pointer_to_unary_function<A, R>(f) {}
 83  };
 84};
 85
 86template <typename R, typename F> 
 87struct Binary_function
 88{
 89  template <typename A1, typename A2>
 90  struct Type : std::binary_function<A1, A2, R>
 91  {
 92    static char const* name() { return "binary"; }
 93
 94    Type(F f) : function_(f) {}
 95
 96    R operator()(A1 a1, A2 a2) const { return function_(a1, a2);}
 97
 98    F function_;
 99  };
100};
101
102/// Partial specialization for Binary_function, taking a std::binary_function 
103/// argument.
104template <typename F>
105struct Binary_function<typename F::result_type, F>
106{
107  template <typename A1, typename A2>
108  struct Type : std::binary_function<typename F::first_argument_type,
109                                     typename F::second_argument_type,
110                                     typename F::result_type>
111  {
112    static char const* name() { return "binary"; }
113
114    Type(F f) : function_(f) {}
115
116    typename F::result_type operator()(typename F::first_argument_type a1,
117				       typename F::second_argument_type a2) const
118    { return function_(a1, a2);}
119
120    F function_;
121  };
122};
123
124/// Partial specialization for Binary_function, taking a function pointer 
125/// argument.
126template <typename A1, typename A2, typename R>
127struct Binary_function<R, R (*)(A1, A2)> 
128{
129  template <typename Dummy1, typename Dummy2>
130  struct Type : std::pointer_to_binary_function<A1, A2, R>
131  {
132    static char const* name() { return "binary"; }
133
134    Type(R (*f)(A1, A2)) : std::pointer_to_binary_function<A1, A2, R>(f) {}
135  };
136};
137
138template <typename R, typename F> 
139struct Ternary_function
140{
141  template <typename A1, typename A2, typename A3>
142  struct Type
143  {
144    typedef A1 first_argument_type;
145    typedef A2 second_argument_type;
146    typedef A3 third_argument_type;
147    typedef R result_type;
148
149    static char const* name() { return "ternary"; }
150
151    Type(F f) : function_(f) {}
152
153    R operator()(A1 a1, A2 a2, A3 a3) const { return function_(a1, a2, a3);}
154
155    F function_;
156  };
157};
158
159/// Partial specialization for Ternary_function, taking a function pointer 
160/// argument.
161template <typename A1, typename A2, typename A3, typename R>
162struct Ternary_function<R, R (*)(A1, A2, A3)> 
163{
164  template <typename Dummy1, typename Dummy2, typename Dummy3>
165  struct Type
166  {
167    typedef A1 first_argument_type;
168    typedef A2 second_argument_type;
169    typedef A3 third_argument_type;
170    typedef R result_type;
171
172    static char const* name() { return "ternary"; }
173
174    Type(R (*f)(A1, A2, A3)) : function_(f) {}
175
176    R operator()(A1 a1, A2 a2, A3 a3) const { return function_(a1, a2, a3);}
177
178    R (*function_)(A1, A2, A3);
179  };
180};
181
182/// These classes ({Unary,Binary,Ternary}_userelt_return_type)
183/// determine the return types for the unary, binary, and ternary
184/// functions, respectively.
185///
186/// They are necessary for Intel C++ (9.0), which has difficulty with the
187///   'impl::Unary_function<R, F>::template Type'
188/// member class template when used directly in the return types for
189/// those functions.
190
191template <typename R, typename F,
192	  template <typename, typename> class View,
193	  typename T, typename Block>
194struct Unary_userelt_return_type
195{
196  typedef
197    typename impl::Unary_operator_return_type<
198      View, T, Block, impl::Unary_function<R, F>::template Type>::view_type
199    type;
200};
201
202template <typename R, typename F,
203	  template <typename, typename> class View,
204	  typename LType, typename LBlock,
205	  typename RType, typename RBlock>
206struct Binary_userelt_return_type
207{
208  typedef
209  typename impl::Binary_operator_return_type<
210    View, LType, LBlock,
211    View, RType, RBlock,
212    impl::Binary_function<R, F> ::template Type>::view_type
213  type;
214};
215
216template <typename R, typename F,
217	  template <typename, typename> class View,
218	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
219	  typename Type2, typename Block2,
220	  typename Type3, typename Block3>
221struct Ternary_userelt_return_type
222{
223  typedef
224    typename impl::Ternary_func_return_type<
225      View, Type1, Block1,
226      View, Type2, Block2,
227      View, Type3, Block3,
228      impl::Ternary_function<R, F>::template Type>::view_type
229    type;
230};
231
232} // namespace vsip::impl
233
234template <typename R, typename F,
235	  template <typename, typename> class View,
236	  typename T, typename Block>
237typename impl::Unary_userelt_return_type<R, F, View, T, Block>::type
238unary(F f, View<T, Block> v)
239{
240  typedef typename impl::Unary_function<R, F>::template Type<T> Function;
241  typedef impl::Unary_operator_return_type<View, T, Block,
242    impl::Unary_function<R, F>::template Type> type_trait;
243  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
244  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
245
246  return view_type(block_type(Function(f), v.block()));
247}
248
249template <typename R,
250	  template <typename, typename> class View,
251	  typename T, typename Block>
252typename 
253impl::Unary_operator_return_type<
254  View, T, Block, impl::Unary_function<R, R(*)(T)>::template Type>::view_type
255unary(R(*f)(T), View<T, Block> v)
256{
257  typedef typename impl::Unary_function<R, R(*)(T)>::template Type<T> Function;
258  typedef impl::Unary_operator_return_type<View, T, Block,
259    impl::Unary_function<R, R(*)(T)>::template Type> type_trait;
260  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
261  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
262
263  return view_type(block_type(Function(f), v.block()));
264}
265
266template <typename F,
267	  template <typename, typename> class View,
268	  typename T, typename Block>
269typename 
270impl::Unary_operator_return_type<
271  View, T, Block, impl::Unary_function<typename F::result_type, F>
272    ::template Type>::view_type
273unary(F f, View<T, Block> v)
274{
275  typedef impl::Unary_operator_return_type<View, T, Block,
276    impl::Unary_function<typename F::result_type, F>::template Type> type_trait;
277  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
278  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
279
280  return view_type(block_type(std::ptr_fun(f), v.block()));
281}
282
283template <typename R, typename F,
284	  template <typename, typename> class View,
285	  typename LType, typename LBlock,
286	  typename RType, typename RBlock>
287typename impl::Binary_userelt_return_type<R, F, View, LType, LBlock,
288					  RType, RBlock>::type
289binary(F f, View<LType, LBlock> v1, View<RType, RBlock> v2)
290{
291  typedef typename impl::Binary_function<R, F>
292    ::template Type<LType, RType> Function;
293  typedef impl::Binary_operator_return_type<
294    View, LType, LBlock,
295    View, RType, RBlock,
296    impl::Binary_function<R, F>::template Type> type_trait;
297  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
298  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
299
300  return view_type(block_type(Function(f), v1.block(), v2.block()));
301}
302
303template <typename R,
304	  template <typename, typename> class View,
305	  typename LType, typename LBlock,
306	  typename RType, typename RBlock>
307typename 
308impl::Binary_operator_return_type<View, 
309				  LType, LBlock,
310				  View,
311				  RType, RBlock,
312		 		  impl::Binary_function<R, R(*)(LType, RType)>
313::template Type>::view_type
314binary(R(*f)(LType, RType), View<LType, LBlock> v1, View<RType, RBlock> v2)
315{
316  typedef typename impl::Binary_function<R, R(*)(LType, RType)>
317    ::template Type<LType, RType> Function;
318  typedef impl::Binary_operator_return_type<View,
319                                            LType, LBlock,
320                                            View,
321                                            RType, RBlock,
322    impl::Binary_function<R, R(*)(LType, RType)>::template Type> type_trait;
323  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
324  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
325
326  return view_type(block_type(Function(f), v1.block(), v2.block()));
327}
328
329template <typename F,
330	  template <typename, typename> class View,
331	  typename LType, typename LBlock,
332	  typename RType, typename RBlock>
333typename 
334impl::Binary_operator_return_type<
335  View, LType, LBlock,
336  View, RType, RBlock,
337  impl::Binary_function<typename F::result_type, F>
338    ::template Type>::view_type
339binary(F f, View<LType, LBlock> v1, View<RType, RBlock> v2)
340{
341  typedef typename impl::Binary_function<typename F::result_type, F>
342    ::template Type<typename F::first_argument_type,
343                    typename F::second_argument_type> Function;
344  typedef impl::Binary_operator_return_type<
345    View, LType, LBlock,
346    View, RType, RBlock,
347    impl::Binary_function<typename F::result_type, F>::template Type> type_trait;
348  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
349  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
350
351  return view_type(block_type(Function(f), v1.block(), v2.block()));
352}

354template <typename R, typename F,
355	  template <typename, typename> class View,
356	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
357	  typename Type2, typename Block2,
358	  typename Type3, typename Block3>
359typename impl::Ternary_userelt_return_type<
360  R, F, View, Type1, Block1, Type2, Block2, Type3, Block3>::type
361ternary(F f,
362	View<Type1, Block1> v1,
363	View<Type2, Block2> v2,
364	View<Type3, Block3> v3)
365{
366  typedef typename 
367    impl::Ternary_function<R, F>::template Type<Type1, Type2, Type3> Function;
368  typedef impl::Ternary_func_return_type<
369    View, Type1, Block1,
370    View, Type2, Block2,
371    View, Type3, Block3,
372    impl::Ternary_function<R, F>::template Type> type_trait;
373  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
374  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
375
376  return view_type(block_type(Function(f), v1.block(), v2.block(), v3.block()));
377}
378
379template <typename R,
380	  template <typename, typename> class View,
381	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
382	  typename Type2, typename Block2,
383	  typename Type3, typename Block3>
384typename 
385impl::Ternary_func_return_type<
386  View, Type1, Block1,
387  View, Type2, Block2,
388  View, Type3, Block3,
389  impl::Ternary_function<R, R(*)(Type1, Type2, Type3)>
390    ::template Type>::view_type
391ternary(R(*f)(Type1, Type2, Type3),
392	View<Type1, Block1> v1,
393	View<Type2, Block2> v2,
394	View<Type3, Block3> v3)
395{
396  typedef typename impl::Ternary_function<R, R(*)(Type1, Type2, Type3)>
397    ::template Type<Type1, Type2, Type3> Function;
398  typedef impl::Ternary_func_return_type<
399  View, Type1, Block1,
400  View, Type2, Block2,
401  View, Type3, Block3,
402  impl::Ternary_function<R, R(*)(Type1, Type2, Type3)>
403    ::template Type> type_trait;
404  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
405  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
406
407  return view_type(block_type(Function(f), v1.block(), v2.block(), v3.block()));
408}
